definition: cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
to prepare to meet the enemy head-on

sentences.english: And she still got the picture of place troops on garrison duty of the liberation army inside cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 并且她还收到了教堂内解放军的布防图。

sentences.english: Back to deal with the foam latex, PVC, and other anti-skid plastic drop cloth.
sentences.chinese: 背面处理有发泡乳胶，PVC，滴塑布防滑等。

sentences.english: French troops, making a last-ditch stand at the river Marne, were in desperate need of reinforcements.
sentences.chinese: 法军背城借一，在马恩河布防，同时亟待增援。

sentences.english: Conditions were similar along the whole stretch of the Roer .
sentences.chinese: 整个沿罗尔河德军布防的状况都差不多。

definition: to garrison/to stand guard/on garrison duty
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to reinforce/to increase troop numbers/reinforcements/extra troops
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
